A careless intern used the same prime for different RSA public keys. Can you recover the secret from 2484287149628069513696048094262328860217939779468522559078564810008752212776738198849967870974019079015919622999628194620352852109040151573336932588624448?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=3702610082973636038952337304282465967593152414307630540044839374938614905293298453520693356717215391415151633546685112245543474262237386360786289806073961, e=416290541229027663184088817945610723574145434100974976249989014619241569362375272792160833832287129365544472740872529139208760656505977478713504178613057

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{516h0gyw}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 2484287149628069513696048094262328860217939779468522559078564810008752212776738198849967870974019079015919622999628194620352852109040151573336932588624448
vulnerability: repeated primes
hint: The RSA modulus n is a perfect square. This often indicates a repeated prime usage vulnerability.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=3702610082973636038952337304282465967593152414307630540044839374938614905293298453520693356717215391415151633546685112245543474262237386360786289806073961, e=416290541229027663184088817945610723574145434100974976249989014619241569362375272792160833832287129365544472740872529139208760656505977478713504178613057
extra_info: p=60849076270504189461971622936429029319280918510996425715105660657948544572781, q=60849076270504189461971622936429029319280918510996425715105660657948544572781, Ï†(n)=3702610082973636038952337304282465967593152414307630540044839374938614905293176755368152348338291448169278775488046550408521481410807175039470392716928400
subtype: repeated_prime_usage
